long_desc: This experiential course is a unique opportunity to combine general and strategic management consulting with international experience. The course is designed to facilitate a realworld experience by organizing the class in groups of students from the Qatar and Pittsburgh campuses and connecting them with companies based in the Middle East for a consulting experience with the following learning outcomes Learn how to scope and execute a consulting plan discovery and identification of problems with client, design of deliverables plan, execute plan Strengthen data collection and analytical skills related to real world problems Enhance collaboration and professional skills with culturally diverse team members across the globe Utilize broad business knowledge to build solutions for real world client Reflect on their professional growth, teamwork, and application of knowledge with an external client.The course requires travel to Doha, Qatar and Pittsburgh, PA with regular meetings throughout mini 3 with the international team and client.

custom_fields.goals: Learn how to scope and execute a consulting plan discovery and identification of problems with client, design of deliverables plan, execute planStrengthen data collection and analytical skills related to real world problemsEnhance collaboration and professional skills with culturally diverse team members across the globe Utilize broad business knowledge to build solutions for real world clientReflect on their professional growth, teamwork, and application of knowledge with an external client.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Project deliverables as determined by client; reflection papers; peer evaluations
custom_fields.relevance: This course is an opportunity to apply class knowledge with an international client, providing key practical experiences as emerging consultants.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: travel to Doha, Qatar for PIT students January 3-10, 2025; travel to Pittsburgh, PA for QBA students February 22-28, 2025
